inn1.comm: starts his England career with a wide down the leg side, started outside leg stump and swung a touch
gets this one full outside off, left alone
comes forward into a pleasing drive, full outside off, not perfectly timed to the right of mid-off
good delivery, back of a length at off stump, touch of extra bounce and takes the splice to the off side...Stirling takes his bottom hand off the bat
defended into the off side
full and angled into leg stump, clipped off the pads through backward square leg
big appeal for lbw! Just shaping down the leg side. Full again, a little straighter than the previous ball, and ducks in late at Stirling who tries to turn it through the on side
gentle loosener outside off, left alone, carries at shin height to Bairstow
full and straight, on middle and off, punched to mid-on
on a length outside off, touch more zip off the surface this time as it's left alone
going across the left hander, at 82mph, who shoulders arms again
touch closer to off stump, defended square into the covers
throws his hands through a drive at a full delivery, skews in the air through the gully area and down to third man
full on the stumps, defended to the covers
on a length outside off, 85mph, left alone
dragged down a little short, Porterfield tries to pull it from outside off and finds mid-on...lack of pace in the pitch not helping that shot
sprayed a little too wide outside off, Porterfield has a dart and misses
back on middle, 85mph, defended to the on side
full on off stump, pushed firmly back down the pitch and Wood sticks out his right hand to field
pushed fuller on off stump, 88mph, the speeds nudging up, driven to mid-off

has Bairstow pulled off a run out? Sharp work if so. Yes, he has! A short-of-a-length delivery deflected down off Stirling's thigh pad, he wasn't sure where it had gone but was called through by Porterfield. The captain made it easily enough, but Stirling is well short at the non-striker's end as Bairstow makes a direct hit having run from behind the stumps
full on middle and off, defended to midwicket
ooh, gets quite a way across his stumps and tries to flick this full delivery away and it takes the pad to the leg side
full on off stump, 82mph, defended to mid-off
plays inside the line of a ball outside off
full on the stumps, defended into the on side
short of a length on the hip, takes the thigh pad to long leg where Rashid is lurking...his first ODI since 2009
oversteps this time, 88mph, short of a length and clipped to the leg side
and that's how to deal with a free hit, it's a full delivery and Porterfield doesn't try anything too cute...shifts his front leg out of the way and drills through the line straight down the ground
down the leg side, this time it's a wide, so becoming a lengthy over
adjusts back onto off stump, full length at 85mph, slides off the face of the bat through backward point
full on middle and off, not much movement, defended to mid-off
not quite so full this time, Joyce opens the face and guides it fine of backward point
back of a length, nips back a touch into Porterfield and takes him on the thigh pad
edged, but doesn't carry. Back of a length at off stump, Joyce trying to open the face again but played with soft hands and the ball died off the edge through to Bairstow
defended into the off side
strong shot from Joyce, full outside off, driven on the up the covers...lovely stroke
drags the length back a little and he opens the face down to third man
on a length at middle and off, defended towards midwicket
back of a length on middle and leg, he shapes to play into the leg side but gets taken high on the pads into the off side
back of a length on off stump, 88mph, nips in a Joyce who takes his bottom hand off the bat as he works into the leg side
this one zings through off a length and is taken on the rise by Bairstow
full outside off, 86mph, left alone
has a flash at this one, full outside off, 89mph, Portefield tried to flay it through the covers
tighter in defence this time, head over the ball and plays square to point

first wicket for Wood! It's a drag on by the Ireland captain. Back of a length outside off, Porterfield tries to cut but is cramped for room and gets a bottom edge into the stumps. The umpires check for the no-ball, it's very clse but a fraction of heel behind the line
full outside off, 81mph, Joyce makes quite a late decision to leave
huge appeal for caught behind! There was a noise. Not out! Lovely ball, full length, nipped away off the seam and squared up Joyce but it takes the back pad. Outstanding decision by Mark Hawthorne
defended to the off side
full and a little wider outside off, left well alone
another one through to the keeper, 81mph compared to around 87-88 from Wood at the other end
well bowled again, nips away off the seam but Joyce holds his bat inside the line
good delivery, on a length just outside off, getting it to skid off the surface through to the keeper...88mph
fantastic stroke, dropped shorter by Wood and O'Brien latches on to pull it in the air over square leg
short of a length outside off, punched from the back foot to cover
dropped, in the gully! He had just come in for this over, but Hales can't hang on to his right O'Brien played a cut. Should have been held
full outside off, jabbed down to third man
repeat of earlier in the over as Wood gets too short, taken from outside off this time and pulls in the air in front of square
full on off stump, defended into the covers
another run out attempt from Bairstow! He's sharp today, but can't hit the stumps this time. Joyce nudged into the leg side, would have been very tight for him but they then get overthrows
driven through the off side
full outside off, Joyce gets well across his crease and defends to backward point
full outside off, 82mph, left alone
full on off stump, defended to the covers
starts full outside off, 80mph, left alone
full and straight, flicked off the stumps in front of square...a man on the deep square boundary now
short of a length outside off, stops in the pitch but Joyce punches it square to point
dragged down short and this time it's Joyce quickly on the pull as the ball skidded onto him a little quicker than he expected, places it behind square
back on a full length at off stump, defended to point
back of a length outside off, 81mph, opens the face down to third man
pushed across full outside off, Joyce still content to leave those alone
back of a length at off stump, slides off an open face wide of second slip

taken at first slip! Couldn't resist a dip at this full, wide delivery. He's been keen to play his shots. Takes a thick edge to Vince who clutches it into his body...not sure that went in completely cleanly, nope it didn't
appeal for lbw first ball, nipped back off a length. Perhaps a touch too high? Was hit above the knee roll. High and sliding down says the replay
full on middle and off, 82mph, punched firmly back towards Bresnan
full on the stumps, Balbirnie getting across his crease so looks an lbw candidate, takes the pad to the leg side
full on off stump, 79mph, onto the front foot and defended to the covers
forward again, punches a full delivery to mid-off
angled into the stumps from a full length, pushed back down the pitch
full outside off, nips into the left hander, bat and pad close together. Willey starts to appeal as it may have been pad first but was outside the line
defended towards midwicket
very full outside off, driven without much timing to the covers...a maiden for Willey
full outside off, 83mph, driven up to mid-off
full again, driven to the off side
back of a length, straighter delivery, defended into the midwicket area
full at off stump, 84mph, Balbirnie onto the front foot and defends to cover
a little wider outside off, on a full length, left alone
back of a length at off stump, 82mph, defended to mid-on and Finn begins with a maiden. Ireland haven't scored since the third wicket fell
on off stump, drop-and-run into the off side...alert from Joyce
pushed across full outside off to the right hander who has a flirt outside off without much footwork, doesn't make contact
gets behind the line and defends to mid-off
going across outside off, dabbed down to third man
full outside off, comes forward to drive and it skews off into midwicket
back of a length at off stump, Joyce calmly opens the face to third man
a fumble at second slip by Roy means there's a single for Joyce as he opens the face again, the ball went along the ground
full outside off, 84mph, defended square to point
full at off stump, defended to mid-off on the front foot
what a ball! Unplayable. Just back of a length, straightens off the seam and turns Balbirnie inside out to beat the outside edge
short of a length, takes his bottom hand off the bat as he defends to the leg side
fuller at off stump, 82mph, pushed towards mid-on...good over from Finn
walks forward into a full ball outside off, almost beats point but there's a diving save
finds the big gap down to third man with an open face
very good shot, punches a full ball on off stump straight of mid-off...lovely piece of timing on a slow surface

good catch! Roy at second slip. This time the delivery is a touch wider, Balbirnie doesn't get his foot to the pitch, goes for a drive and edges high to the right of Roy who grabs it with both hands. Maiden international scalp for Willey
full at off stump, hint of movement, defended to the off side
another strong drive, this time by Wilson to get him off the mark, as he places this square through the off side
length ball in the channel, defended coming forwards... sand puffs up from the footmarks
oof, that's a tough one for Wilson, nip-backer, touch short and it's perilously close to the crown jewels, hits him on the thigh
on the stumps, touch back of a length and defended
lovely from Finn, beautiful line and length and Wilson is drawn forward, pushing at it blindly as the ball seams and bounces past the bat
pitched up around off stump, lines this one up in defence
pitched full of a length, on off stump, closes the face and works the ball to midwicket - another maiden for Finn
